executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2022 currency. Operators in the Eyeglasses Frames Manufacturing industry produce eyeglasses frames using plastics, metals, and other materials, as well as parts used in eyeglasses. Consumers have increased expenditure on frames over the five years to 2022 as a result of increased per capita disposable income and federal funding for Medicare and Medicaid. However, operators have experienced continued pressure from external competition, primarily imports, which account for almost half of domestic demand in 2022. While international trade was halted due to the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic, an appreciating US dollar during the period has benefited foreign manufacturers and has hindered exports. Overall, industry revenue is expected to increase at an annualized rate of 0.2% to $1.9 billion over the five years to 2022, including an increase of 1.5% in 2022 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Revenue declined 6.9% in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic slowing operations and reducing consumer spending. However, revenue rebounded in 2021 as the economy recovered and businesses reopened, enabling consumers to visit optometrists.

Industry revenue is expected to increase at an annualized rate of 0.2% to $1.9 billion over the five years to 2022, including 1.5% growth in 2022. Profit as a percentage of revenue rose from 6.3% in 2017 to 8.3% in 2022.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry is expected to continue growing gradually over the next five years as pandemic effects subside. Revenue is forecast to rise at an annualized 2.0% to $2.1 billion from 2022-2027.
Profit margins are expected to increase from 8.3% of revenue in 2022 to 8.6% in 2027 as economic conditions improve.
A projected depreciation of the US dollar will limit import growth while boosting exports from 2022-2027. Imports are expected to decline as a share of domestic demand.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures frames for eyeglasses from purchased materials.

opportunities: Federal funding for Medicare and Medicaid

key_trends: The industry has benefited from the rise in disposable income and consumer spending
Import growth has been aided by an increased trade-weighted index
Many small companies have struggled to compete with overseas manufacturers
Effective research and product development will determine the future success of industry operators
The federal funding for Medicaid and Medicare is expected to rise
Industry exports are expected to rise following a period of significant declines

market_segmentation.segment_description: The wholesale segment accounts for the largest portion of downstream buyers. IBISWorld estimates that the wholesale segment makes up 42.0% of industry revenue in 2022, declining as a share of revenue during the period.

Manufacturers sell a portion of what it produces in brick-and-mortar establishments located across the United States. Often referred to as direct-to-customer, these stores account for an estimated 38.7% of industry revenue in 2022.

In 2022, exports are expected to account for 13.2% of revenue for the Eyeglasses Frames Manufacturing industry. Over the five years to 2022, industry exports have decreased as a share of revenue, primarily due to the appreciation of the US dollar and global supply chain issues.

E-commerce has grown in popularity in recent years, as some of the largest eyeglass frame manufactures move their products to an online platform. In 2020, due to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, consumers were forced to move their shopping online to stay in line with stay-at-home orders across the United States. This segment is estimated to make up 6.1% of industry revenue in 2022, rising as a share of revenue during the period.

products_and_services.product_description: Men's eyeglasses frames make up a large portion of products in the Eyeglasses Frames Manufacturing industry. IBISWorld estimates that men's frames take up 41.5% of industry revenue in 2022, growing as a share of revenue over the five years to 2022.

Women's frames make up the largest portion of industry revenue. IBISWorld estimates that women's frames make up 47.1% of industry revenue in 2022, remaining stable as a share of revenue over the past five years.

Children's frames make up the smallest share of industry revenue, which is due to the fact that only 25.0% of children require the use of corrective eyewear, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

tier_2_suppliers: Iron & Steel Manufacturing in the US
Screw, Nut & Bolt Manufacturing in the US
Copper Rolling, Drawing & Extruding in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The key factors that determine demand for products made in the Eyeglasses Frames Manufacturing industry are demographics of the US population and the cost of optometry services and products.
Demand for eyeglasses frames can also be affected by the health of the population.
The cost of optometry services influences the number of people who visit the optometrist and the frequency of their visits.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The Eyeglasses Frames Manufacturing industry operates at a trade deficit, with the value of imports drastically exceeding exports.
The value of exports is expected to contract at an annualized rate of 8.0% to $286.9 million over the past five years.

business_locations.location_description: The West region has the highest percentage of establishments.
The Great Lakes region has a relatively higher percentage of both establishments and population.
The Southeast region has a relatively higher percentage of both establishments and population.
The Mid-Atlantic region has a relatively higher percentage of both establishments and population.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulates the Eyeglasses Frames Manufacturing industry.

When an industry operator wants clearance to market a device, the company must submit a premarket notification to the FDA demonstrating that the device is substantially equivalent to a previously cleared device.
A Premarket Application (PMA) must be submitted if any device cannot be cleared through the 510(k) premarket notification procedures.

barriers_points.barrier_description: High capital costs associated with manufacturing eyeglasses frames may deter new entrants.
Highly skilled workforce needed throughout design, development and production to compete with existing operators.

factors_increased_barrier: High and increasing level of globalization
High and steady level of competition

basis_points.basis_description: Operators compete on price and quality of products.
Rising imports satisfy 47.2% of domestic demand in 2022, driven by appreciating US dollar.

concentration_points.concentration_description: EssilorLuxottica SA is the largest player with 37.6% market share in 2022.
Significant capital investment needed to leverage economies of scale.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit varies widely among operators and depends on their scale and scope of production.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Cost structure varies from producer to producer
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Cost structure for the Eyeglasses Frames Manufacturing industry is based on the average enterprise.
Industry profit has been threatened by increased levels of price-based competition associated with rising import penetration into the industry.
The COVID-19 pandemic has hindered profit growth as some operators were forced to either halt operations or work at low capacity in 2020.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Capital expenditure in this industry is required to manufacture highly technical eyeglass frames.
Despite increased reliance on capital equipment and machinery, skilled workers are required to research, develop and monitor the quality of eyeglass frames.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The primary driver of industry revenue volatility has been fluctuations in the trade-weighted index.
New surgical ophthalmic solutions often encourage people to have surgery.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: EssilorLuxottica SA's patented Avatar technology is working to change the way consumers choose eyeglass frames.
The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: Many manufacturers have invested in developing new varieties of frames that offer more comfort and durability.

FAQs.question: Have supply chain disruptions during the pandemic increased your operating costs?
FAQs.answer: Plastic resin, a derivative of crude oil, is a key input in many apparel-manufacturing processes.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers with a wide variety of products are able to bring in higher profit.

FAQs.question: Have you looked into setting up manufacturing facilities in lower-wage regions of the country?
FAQs.answer: Many manufacturers consider relocation for lower labor costs.

FAQs.question: Has your company faced competition from low-cost imports from overseas?
FAQs.answer: Imports from Japan have been rising rapidly.
